title: Ekauni
text:
Ekauni is a village in <a href="Khiron">Khiron</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is located 5 km from <a href="Lalganj%2C%20Uttar%20Pradesh">Lalganj</a>, the tehsil headquarters. As of 2011, it has a population of 1,466 people, in 256 households. It has one primary school and one medical clinic.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Ekauni as comprising 3 hamlets, with a total population of 666 people (326 male and 340 female), in 128 households and 112 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 406 <a href="acre">acre</a>s.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Ekauni as having a population of 884 people, in 178 households, and having an area of 170.58 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were given as wheat and rice.
